City of Richmond Report to Development Permit Panel: A Development Permit is recommended for the construction of a high-rise building with approximately 81 dwelling units at 6333 Cooney Road, which is zoned as "High Rise Apartment (ZHR8) Brighouse Village (City Centre)". 

Staff Report: 6333 Cooney Road Limited Partnership has applied for permission to develop a high-rise building with approximately 81 dwelling units at 6333 Cooney Road. The site is currently vacant and is zoned as "High Rise Apartment (ZHR8) Brighouse Village (City Centre)". 

Zoning: The site is zoned as "High Rise Apartment (ZHR8) Brighouse Village (City Centre)". Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 8738 (RZ 09-506908), and associated Development Permit (DP 09-506909) were approved in 2012, but the development did not proceed. A new Development Permit (DP 17-791045) was issued in 2022, and due to design changes, a new Development Permit (DP 22-023105) is required. 

Servicing Agreement: An associated Servicing Agreement (SA 19-858294) is under staff review and will be required for the issuance of this Development Permit. Updated design drawings and a new Letter of Credit security are also required. The Servicing Agreement includes the design and construction of a new City lane, Cooney Road frontage improvements, and sanitary sewer improvements. 

Development Information: Please refer to the attached Development Application Data Sheet for a comparison of the proposed development data with the relevant Bylaw requirements. 

Background: Surrounding the subject site are a 14-storey residential tower to the north, a three-storey townhouse development across Cooney Road to the east, a one-storey single detached house across a proposed lane to the south, and two four-storey wood frame apartment buildings to the west. 

Staff Comments: The proposed development complies with urban design issues, staff comments, and the Official Community Plan. It is generally in compliance with the "High Rise Apartment (ZHR8) Brighouse Village (City Centre)" zone. 

Advisory Design Panel Comments: The Advisory Design Panel supports the application, subject to their comments. 

Analysis: The development is located at the southeast corner of the site to maximize distance from neighboring residential development. Landscape buffers and design features are included to provide separation and visual interest. The development will be accessed from a new City lane, and the site is located within an Aircraft Noise Policy area. 

Urban Design and Site Planning: The proposed development takes advantage of the site's proximity to the Canada Line and the new City lane. Access to the site will be from the new lane, and service uses will be screened from public view.

City of Richmond Development Permit Panel
From: Wayne Craig, Director of Development
Date: September 6, 2023
File: DP 22-011557
Re: Application by Jacky He for a Development Permit at 6531 Francis Road

Staff Recommendation: Issue a Development Permit for the construction of two front-to-back duplexes at 6531 Francis Road, with shared vehicle access from Francis Road. The lots are zoned "Arterial Road Two-Unit Dwellings (RDA)."

Staff Report:
- Jacky He has applied on behalf of the property owner, Ya T Wang, to develop two front-to-back duplexes at 6531 Francis Road.
- The site is being rezoned from "Single Detached (RSl/E)" to "Arterial Road Two-Unit Dwellings (RDA)" under Bylaw 10332 (RZ 19-878165).
- The site currently contains a single-family dwelling that will be demolished at a future subdivision stage.
- A Servicing Agreement is required for subdivision approval, including water, storm, and sanitary sewer connections, as well as frontage works.
- Development surrounding the site consists of single-family homes and a duplex.

Rezoning and Public Hearing Results:
- Design issues were identified during the rezoning process and have been resolved at the Development Permit stage.
- The proposed duplexes have been refined to comply with design guidelines and fit into the neighborhood.
- Decks have been altered and reduced in size, and compliance with lot width and depth envelopes has been confirmed.
- Aging-in-place features and a convertible unit have been included in all units.
- Landscape plans have been provided, including on-site tree planting.
- No concerns were expressed by the public during the Public Hearing for the rezoning.

Public Input during the Development Permit Application Process:
- No comments have been received from the public regarding the placement of the DP Application Notification Sign.

Staff Comments:
- The proposed scheme satisfactorily addresses urban design issues and staff comments.
- It complies with the Official Community Plan and the "RDA" zone.

City of Richmond Development Permit Panel
From: Wayne Craig, Director of Development
Date: September 6, 2023
File: DP 21-945828
Re: Application by Greater Vancouver Sewerage and Drainage District for a Development Permit at 900 and 1000 Ferguson Road

Staff Recommendation: Issue a Development Permit at 900 and 1000 Ferguson Road for upgrades to the wastewater treatment plant in the designated Environmentally Sensitive Area.

Background: The Greater Vancouver Sewerage and Drainage District has applied for a Development Permit to incorporate secondary and tertiary treatment facilities into the existing wastewater treatment plant at 900 and 1000 Ferguson Road. The site is currently designated as an Environmentally Sensitive Area, requiring an ESA Development Permit.

The proposed project footprint is 23.9 ha, with 20.96 ha situated within the designated ESA. In compensation for disturbing 21 ha of ESA, GVS&DD has committed to planting and rehabilitating 26.2 ha of the island.

Previous ESA Development Permits have been issued for this site, allowing for the expansion of the wastewater treatment plant and construction of related facilities. The proposed project includes the development of previously secured ESA compensation areas.

Development Information: The subject site is currently occupied by buildings and structures associated with the existing wastewater treatment plant.

Development surrounding the site includes the North Arm of the Fraser River to the north, Iona Beach Regional Park to the east, Iona Island causeway to the south, and Iona Beach and North Arm Jetty to the west.

Staff Comments: The proposed scheme addresses ESA issues and complies with the Official Community Plan and zoning requirements. No variances are being sought.

Advisory Design Panel Comments: The Advisory Design Panel has not reviewed the application as it does not involve building design components.

Analysis: The IIWWTP currently provides primary sewage treatment through sludge removal and anaerobic digestion. The proposed upgrades will enhance the treatment process.

Site Planning: The proposed project will incorporate secondary and tertiary treatment facilities into the existing wastewater treatment plant.

City of Richmond Report to Development Permit Panel
To: Development Permit Panel
Date: September 18, 2023
From: Wayne Craig
File: DV 23-024175
Re: Director, Development Application by Khalid Hassan for a Development Variance Permit at 7151, 7211, 7231 & 7251 Bridge Street

Staff Recommendation:
- Issue a Development Variance Permit to vary the provisions of Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500 for the following:
   1. Reduce the minimum required rear yard setback for a portion of the second storey from 10.70 m to 10.64 m at 7151 Bridge Street to retain an existing second-storey deck.
   2. Reduce the minimum required rear yard setback for accessory buildings with a wall length greater than 6.0 m from 2.4 m to 2.08 m at 7211 Bridge Street to retain an existing detached garage.
   3. Reduce the minimum required rear yard setback for 60% of the first storey from 9.60 m to 7.4 m, as well as the remaining 40% of the first storey and the second storey from 10.70 m to 8.0 m at 7231 Bridge Street to retain an existing dwelling. Also, reduce the minimum required rear yard setback for a portion of the second storey from 10.7 m to 6.8 m to retain an existing second-storey deck.
   4. Reduce the minimum required rear yard setback for 60% of the first storey from 9.60 m to 7.02 m, as well as the remaining 40% of the first storey and the second storey from 10.70 m to 7.02 m at 7251 Bridge Street to retain an existing dwelling.

Background:
- Khalid Hassan has applied on behalf of the owners for permission to reduce the minimum rear yard setback requirements for four properties in a proposed 16 lot subdivision.
- The properties were part of a rezoning application adopted by City Council on December 21, 2022.
- The rezoning application aims to create six lots fronting Bridge Street and ten lots fronting an extension to Armstrong Street while retaining the existing homes on Bridge Street.
- Variances to the rear yard setback provisions are required for four of the lots on Bridge Street.

Development Information:
- The subject properties are part of a rezoning application to create 16 single-family lots.
- The proposed variances are necessary to retain the existing structures on four of the lots.
- If the variances are not approved, the existing structures would need to be modified or removed before subdivision approval.

Analysis:
- The applicant requests variances to reduce the minimum rear yard setbacks for various reasons.
- Staff supports the proposed variances because they do not facilitate new construction and only permit the retention of existing houses in good condition.
- Any new construction would still need to comply with the minimum setback requirements of Zoning Bylaw 8500.
- The retention of existing single-family homes was identified during the rezoning application.
- The proposed setback variances do not affect the tree retention secured through the rezoning process or the applicant's commitment to provide new trees on-site.
- The adjacent properties to the west, created upon subdivision, will be owned by the applicant.

To: Development Permit Panel
Date: October 4, 2023
From: Wayne Craig
File: DP 17-790086
Director, Development

Re: Application by Jhujar Construction Ltd. for a Development Permit at 9291 and 9311/9331 No. 2 Road

Staff Recommendation: Issue a Development Permit for the construction of 12 townhouse units and one secondary suite at 9291 and 9311/9331 No. 2 Road. The site is zoned "Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)" with vehicle access provided via 9211 No. 2 Road.

Wayne Craig
Director, Development
(604-247-4625)

Staff Report

Origin: DP 17-790086

Jhujar Construction Ltd. has applied to the City of Richmond to develop 12 townhouse units at 9291 and 9311/9331 No. 2 Road. Vehicle access will be through a Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) registered on the adjacent property at 9211 No. 2 Road. One of the townhouse units will have a ground-level secondary suite and two units will be designed as convertible units. The site is being rezoned from "Single Detached (RS 1/E)" and "Two-Unit Dwellings (RDl)" zones to "Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)" zone. A Servicing Agreement is required prior to Building Permit issuance.

Development Information

Please refer to the attached Development Application Data Sheet (Attachment 1) for a comparison of the proposed development data with the relevant bylaw requirements.

Background

Development surrounding the subject site:
- To the north: A ten-unit townhouse complex on a lot zoned "Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)".
- To the east: A four-storey senior's apartment building on a lot zoned "Medium Density Low Rise Apartments (RAM 1)" and a church on a lot zoned "Assembly (ASY)".
- To the south: Existing single-family homes on lots zoned "Single Detached (RS 1/E)".
- To the west: Existing single-family dwellings on lots zoned "Single-Detached (RS 1/B)".

Rezoning and Public Hearing Results

The Public Hearing for the rezoning of this site was held on October 16, 2017. No concerns were expressed at the Public Hearing.

Staff Comments

The proposed scheme satisfactorily addresses urban design issues and complies with the Official Community Plan and the "Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)" zone.

Advisory Design Panel Comments

The Advisory Design Panel supports the project.

Analysis

Conditions of Adjacency:
- The proposed buildings address the massing of the surrounding residential developments.
- Building height is stepped down to provide a transition to adjacent properties.
- Privacy and overlook concerns are minimized.
- Site grade will be raised or maintained to match existing grades and accommodate tree retention.
- Hedgerows and trees will be retained and planted to enhance interfaces between the proposed development and existing residential developments.

Transportation and Site Access:
- Vehicle access is proposed through an existing Statutory Right-of-Way registered over the drive aisle of the neighboring townhouse development.
- No direct vehicle access to No. 2 Road is permitted from the subject site.

Staff Recommendation: Issue a Development Permit for the redevelopment of the BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance Unit and future subdivision at 12700 and 12800 Rice Mill Road and 12280 and 12300 No. 5 Road, which is designated as an Environmentally Sensitive Area.

Project Description:
- SNC Lavalin Inc., on behalf of BC Ferry Services Inc., has applied for a Development Permit for the redevelopment of the BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance Unit and related components at the specified locations.
- The site is being rezoned from Agricultural (AGl) and Light Industrial (IL) to BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance and Moorage (ZI 14) to allow for the upgrading of the BC Ferries FMU.
- The Development Permit application includes habitat compensation and mitigation measures for the designated Environmentally Sensitive Areas and Riparian Management Areas on the site.
- A Servicing Agreement is required for infrastructure upgrades and dike works.

Summary of FMU Works and Improvements:
- Construction of a new machine shop building and supporting uses at the southeast portion of the site.
- Renovations, modifications, and additions to existing buildings.
- Addition of off-street parking, loading, and bike parking provisions.

- Demolition of existing buildings at the southeast portion of the site.

- There is a designated Riparian Management Area associated with an existing watercourse along Rice Mill Road.

City of Richmond Report to Development Permit Panel
To: Development Permit Panel
Date: November 6, 2023
From: Wayne Craig
File: DP 18-843281
Director of Development
Re: Application by Lovick Scott Architects for a Development Permit at #115 - 10700 Cambie Road
Staff Recommendation: That a Development Permit be issued for exterior renovations and minor on-site upgrades to the existing McDonald's restaurant at #115 - 10700 Cambie Road on a site zoned "Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)".

Staff Report
Origin: DP 18-843281
Lovick Scott Architects has applied for permission to undertake exterior building renovations to the existing McDonald's restaurant located at #115 10700 Cambie Road. This includes upgrades to the on-site landscaping and the existing garbage and recycling enclosure on a site zoned "Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)".

Development Information
This Development Permit only applies to the portion of the building that contains the existing McDonald's restaurant (Unit 115) and immediate surrounding on-site landscaping and vehicle circulation areas. No rezoning application is required, and no servicing or infrastructure works are needed.

Background
The existing McDonald's restaurant is a one-storey building with a drive-through service component. The proposed modifications will only be made to the McDonald's restaurant and not the neighboring commercial retail unit. The site is part of a commercial complex with other businesses and off-street parking.

Development surrounding the subject site:
- To the north: a business park zoned "Industrial Business Park (IB 1)"
- To the east: an access road and a one-storey commercial building on a site zoned "Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)"
- To the south: Highway 99 and an existing hotel on a site zoned "Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)"
- To the west: Highway 99 and the off-ramp for the Cambie Road overpass

Staff Comments
The proposed scheme satisfactorily addresses urban design issues and staff comments. It complies with the Official Community Plan and the "Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)" zone.

Advisory Design Panel Comments
Due to the minor nature of the renovations, the application was not presented to the Advisory Design Panel.

Analysis
Conditions of Adjacency:
- Modifications to the on-site enclosure for garbage, recycling, and organic waste are being undertaken. The enclosure will be fully enclosed and screened from the sidewalk.
- No modifications to the building's mechanical systems are required.
- Existing rooftop mechanical units will be screened.
- Drive-through operations audio/speaker box system is oriented to minimize impacts and adjust volume based on ambient noise conditions.
- No acoustical study was required.

Urban Design and Site Planning:
- The modifications are primarily limited to the building exterior, existing landscape areas, and service area.
- Off-street parking, vehicle circulation, and drive-through servicing will generally remain unchanged.
- Additional modifications include parking stall curb stops, pavement markings, maintaining pedestrian linkage, and implementing additional signage.
- The drive-through configuration will be maintained.
- The surrounding off-street parking provides for 25 vehicle parking stalls, complying with requirements.

To: City of Richmond Development Permit Panel
From: Wayne Craig, Director of Development
Date: November 6, 2023
File: DP 21-944169

Staff Recommendation: Issue a Development Permit at 11191 Twigg Place for the installation of a barge loading facility on an Environmentally Sensitive Area (ESA) site.

Background: Weaver Technical Corp. has applied for a Development Permit to build a barge ramp at 11191 Twigg Place. The site is currently zoned as "Industrial (I)" and is used for truck and industrial equipment storage. There are no permanent structures on the site, except for two shipping containers used as an office space. The proposed barge ramp would be located within the ESA portion of the site.

Staff Comments: The proposed barge ramp would impact the ESA designated areas on the site. While industrial uses are allowed without a Development Permit, the installation of a barge loading facility within the ESA requires an ESA Development Permit. The proposed scheme addresses environmental concerns and complies with the Official Community Plan and the "Industrial (I)" zone.

Analysis: The owner plans to construct a barge ramp in the water lot in front of the site for transporting aggregate materials. No aggregate materials would be stored on-site. The water lot is currently leased and used for log storage. The owner has entered into a memorandum of understanding with the leaseholder and has submitted a crown land lease application to the Province for the change in water lot use. Access to the ramp would be provided via a truck staging area and a drive aisle on the site. The development would not include any additional buildings or structures beyond the barge ramp. The existing office operation in the shipping containers would remain. The site would be raised to prepare for future dike improvements and climate change effects, with lock block walls installed along the property lines. Truck traffic would access the barges via the raised surface.

Senior Governmental Approvals: The proposed barge ramp facility requires approvals from multiple regulatory agencies in addition to the City of Richmond.

City of Richmond Development Permit Panel Report

Date: November 6, 2023
File: DP 18-829236
Re: Application by 1132865 BC Ltd. for a General Compliance Ruling at 7580 No. 1 Road

Staff Recommendation: The attached plans involving changes to the Tree Management Plan and Landscape Plan are in General Compliance with the approved Development Permit (DP 18-829236).

Background: 1132865 BC Ltd. has requested a General Compliance ruling to modify the Tree Management Plan and Landscape Plan for the construction of 30 townhouse units at 7580 No. 1 Road. The rezoning of the site to the "Medium Density Townhouse (RTM2)" zone was approved by Council on October 12, 2021. The Development Permit (DP 18-829236) was also issued on October 12, 2021. The development is nearing completion with interior finishing work in progress and landscaping work remaining.

Staff Comments: The proposed modification to the Tree Management Plan and Landscape Plan is to address the deterioration and irreversible decline of a tree (Tree Tag #726) that was supposed to be retained. The proposed changes do not impact any works associated with the Servicing Agreement.

Summary of Tree Protection and Replacement Plan:
- Ten trees were identified to be retained and protected, with this report specifically addressing Tree 726.
- The south side yard setback at the southwest corner of the site was increased to 7.56 m to retain the Sycamore maple tree (Tree 726).
- Tree protection fencing was installed around all retained trees prior to construction activities.
- A Tree Management Plan and Landscape Plan were issued with the Development Permit.
- The applicant agreed to plant 62 new trees on-site, including 13 conifers and 49 deciduous trees.

Analysis: Tree 726 has shown signs of decline since June 2022 and is in an advanced state of irreversible decline, according to the Project Arborist's findings. The City's Tree Preservation staff have reviewed and agreed with these findings.

Note: Attachments 1-5 provide additional details and plans related to the General Compliance ruling.

Report to Committee
To: Planning Committee
Date: October 23, 2023
From: Wayne Craig, Director, Development

Staff Report
Origin
Navreet Gill has applied on behalf of the property owners, 1303287 B.C. Ltd. (Balraj Singh Sanghera and Rajbir Kaur Chatha), to rezone 11831/11833 Seabrook Crescent from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone in order to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from Seabrook Crescent. A location map and aerial photo are provided in Attachment 1. The proposed subdivision plan and draft site plan are provided in Attachment 2.

Findings of Fact
A Development Application Data Sheet providing details about the development proposal is attached (Attachment 3).

Subject Site Existing Housing Profile
The subject site contains an existing un-stratified non-conforming duplex (two-unit dwelling), which will be demolished prior to subdivision. Both dwelling units are currently tenant occupied and do not contain any secondary suites. The applicant has indicated that the tenants are aware of the redevelopment proposal and the applicant will ensure compliance with the Residential Tenancy Act.

Surrounding Development
Development immediately surrounding the site is as follows:
To the North: A single-family houses on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”.
To the South: A single-family houses on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”.
To the East: Across the lane, an existing duplex on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)” fronting onto No. 5 Road. There is a Rezoning application and Development Permit (RZ 22-019002/DP 23-028942) at 10111/10113 No. 5 Road to permit the development of three front-back duplex lots. The rezoning application received third reading on October 16, 2023.
To the West: Across Seabrook Crescent, an existing duplex on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”.

Related Policies & Studies
Official Community Plan
The subject site is designated as “Neighbourhood Residential” in the Official Community Plan (OCP). This proposal is consistent with this OCP designation.

PLN - 40
October 23, 2023
- 3 -
RZ 22-010976
7409688
Single-Family Lot Size Policy 5434/ Zoning Bylaw 8500
The subject property is located within the area covered by Lot Size Policy 5434, adopted by City Council in 1990, amended in 1991 and 2006 (Attachment 4). The Policy permits a majority of lots within the Policy Area (including the subject property) to be rezoned and subdivided in accordance with the provisions of the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone.

The subject site is currently occupied by a legal duplex. Section 2.3.7 of Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500 provides that the Lot Size Policy does not apply to a rezoning that a legal duplex and which are intended to be subdivided into no more than two single-family lots. The proposed rezoning and subdivision complies with Section 2.3.7 and would result in the creation of two single-family lots being 444.9 m2 and 450.2 m2 in area. Further, the proposed rezoning and subdivision would comply with the minimum lot dimensions and size applicable to the “Single Detached (RS2B)” zone.

Ministry of Transportation & Infrastructure Approval
As the subject site is located within 800 m of an intersection of a Provincial Limited Access Highway and a City road, this redevelopment proposal was referred to the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MOTI) for review and comment. Preliminary confirmation has been received from MOTI indicating that they have no objections to the proposed redevelopment. Final approval from MOTI is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.

Floodplain Management Implementation Strategy
The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. Registration of a flood indemnity covenant on Title is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.

Public Consultation
A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property. Staff have not received any comments from the public about the rezoning application in response to the placement of the rezoning sign on the property.

Should the Planning Committee endorse this application and Council grant first reading to the rezoning bylaw, the bylaw will be forwarded to a Public Hearing, where any area resident or interested party will have an opportunity to comment.

Public notification for the Public Hearing will be provided as per the Local Government Act and the City’s Zoning Bylaw 8500.

Staff Recommendation: That Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10497, for the rezoning of 10840/10860 Bonavista Gate from the “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/C)” zone, be introduced and given first reading.

REPORT CONCURRENCE
Affordable Housing
CONCURRENCE OF GENERAL MANAGER C OF GPH - 111

Pati Yik of Kennon Construction has applied on behalf of the property owners, Thomas Mau Shing Ng, Ling Y Ha and Shui Ting Chua to the City of Richmond to rezone 10840 and 10860 Bonavista Gate from the “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/C)” zone in order to subdivide the existing duplex lot into two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from Bonavista Gate.

Findings of Fact: A Development Application Data Sheet providing details about the development proposal is attached.

Subject Site Existing Housing Profile: This site is currently occupied by an existing duplex (two-family) dwelling, which will be demolished prior to subdivision. The existing two-family dwelling is owner-occupied and does not contain any secondary suites.

Surrounding Development: To the North: An existing strata-titled duplex on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”. To the South: Existing single detached houses on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”. To the East: An existing strata-titled duplex on a lot zoned “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)”. To the West: Single family dwellings on lots zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)” across Bonavista Gate.

Related Policies & Studies: Official Community Plan/Steveston Area Plan: The property is designated as Neighbourhood Residential in the Official Community Plan (OCP), and as Single Family in the Steveston Area Plan.

Floodplain Management Implementation Strategy: The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. Registration of a flood indemnity covenant on Title is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.

Public Consultation: A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property. Staff have not received any comments from the public about the rezoning application in response to the placement of the rezoning sign on the property. Should the Planning Committee endorse this application and Council grant first reading to the rezoning bylaw, the bylaw will be forwarded to a Public Hearing, where any area resident or interested party will have an opportunity to comment. Public notification for the Public Hearing will be provided as per the Local Government Act and the City’s Zoning Bylaw 8500.

Analysis: Proposed Rezoning and Subdivision: The applicant is proposing to rezone the subject site and subdivide it into two single-family lots, each with a secondary suite, with access from Bonavista Gate. This development proposal is consistent with development in the area. The proposed subdivision plan and site plan are shown in Attachment 2. Staff worked with the applicant to modify the building envelope to enable retention of trees on site at the front and rear of the property.

Existing Legal Encumbrances: There is a 3.0 m wide Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) in the backyard along the eastern property line for sanitary sewer utility purposes. The applicant has been advised that encroachment into the SRW is not permitted. A City Covenant is registered on both 10840 and 10860 Bonavista Gate Titles that restrict the development to a duplex, therefore, the duplex covenants must be discharged from Title prior to the final adoption of the rezoning bylaw. There is a Land Tax Deferment Act Agreement currently registered on the 10840 Bonavista Gate Title (proposed Lot A), which allows the property owner to defer the payment of taxes. All deferred taxes must be paid and the agreement must be discharged from Title prior to the preparation and registration of any legal documents associated with this rezoning application.

Transportation and Site Access: Vehicle access is proposed to be from Bonavista Gate for both of the proposed lots. The existing driveways will be removed and new driveways will be constructed as detailed in the Site Servicing and Frontage Improvements sub-section of this report. Two parking spaces will be provided for each dwelling unit in the garage.

The Steveston Area Land Use Map designation is “Multiple-Family”. The proposal also complies with the Arterial Road Land Use Policy and the Floodplain Management Implementation Strategy.

Public Consultation: No comments have been received from the public regarding the rezoning application.

CONCURRENCE OF GENERAL MANAGER PH - 5

Staff Report
Origin: Matthew Cheng, on behalf of 1124053 B.C. LTD (Director: Pavendeep Kooner), has applied to the City of Richmond for permission to rezone 7300 St. Albans Road from the "Single Detached (RS1/E)" zone to the "High Density Townhouses (RTH1)" zone to permit the development of four townhouse units with one secondary suite (Attachment 1).

Findings of Fact
A Development Application Data Sheet providing details about the development proposal is attached (Attachment 2).

Subject Site Existing Housing Profile
The subject site contains an unoccupied single-family dwelling.

Surrounding Development
To the North: The St. Albans' Anglican Church zoned "Assembly (ASY)".
To the South: A seven-unit townhouse complex zoned "Medium Density Low Rise Apartments (RAM1)".
To the East: A 36-unit townhouse complex zoned "Medium Density Low Rise Apartments (RAM1)".
To the West: Across St. Albans Road, a three-storey apartment (over a single-storey parking structure) zoned "Medium Density Low Rise Apartments (RAM1)".

Existing Legal Encumbrances
There is a City Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) registered on Title of the subject property for the sanitary sewer located along the east property line. The applicant has been advised that encroachment into the SRW is not permitted.

Related Policies & Studies
Official Community Plan/City Centre Area Plan
The subject property is designated as "Neighbourhood Residential" in the Official Community Plan (OCP). The subject property is also located within the City Centre Area, Schedule 2.10 of the OCP and is designated "Sub-Area B.1: Mixed Used - Low Rise Residential & Limited Commercial" which is intended for grade-oriented housing in the form of townhouses with a common parking structure of conventional and stacked townhouses.

PH - 6
The proposed development provides for a similar form to the adjacent development to the south and the preliminary design complies with the Sub-Area B.1 guidelines in terms of land use, density and overall neighbourhood character. At the Development Permit (DP) stage, the townhouses' design, form and character will be further reviewed.

As set out in the City Centre Area Plan, the applicant is required to provide a contribution at a rate of $0.34 per buildable square foot for future City Community Planning studies.

Registration of a legal agreement on Title is required, ensuring that future owners are aware that the development is subject to potential impacts due to other developments that may be approved within the City Centre.

St. Albans Sub-Area Plan
The proposed development is consistent with the Multi-Family Low Rise land use designation in the St. Albans Sub-Area Plan, which envisions three-storey apartments, townhouses, two-family or single-family dwellings (Attachment 3). The proposal for four three-storey townhouse units and one secondary suite is also generally consistent with the surrounding developments.

Floodplain Management Implementation Strategy
The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. Registration of a flood indemnity covenant on Title is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.

Public Consultation
A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property. Staff have not yet received any comments from the public about the rezoning application in response to the rezoning sign on site.

Should the Planning Committee endorse this application and Council grant first reading to the rezoning bylaw, the public will have an opportunity to further comment on all of the proposed amendments at a Public Hearing.

Public notification of the Public Hearing will be provided as per the Local Government Act and the City's Zoning Bylaw 8500.

Analysis
Built Form and Architectural Character
The applicant proposes to construct a total of four townhouse units and one secondary suite with access from St. Albans Road. The layout of the townhouse units is oriented around a single driveway providing access to the site from St. Albans Road and a north-south internal maneuvering aisle providing access to the unit garages. A total of two three-storey duplex clusters are proposed.

PH - 7

- Schedule C (Rates and Charges) in Bylaw 8641 is deleted in its entirety and replaced with a new Schedule C attached as Schedule A to the bylaw.

RECOMMENDATION TO REFER
Rezone the lands at 848 Seymour Street from DD District to CD-1 District, increase maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 5.75 to 17.67, and maximum building height from 91.4 m to 97.7 m to allow for a 30-storey hotel. Refer the rezoning application and plans to Public Hearing with the recommendation to approve the application, subject to conditions.
FURTHER instruct the Director of Legal Services to prepare necessary by-laws for consideration at the Public Hearing.
RECOMMENDATION FOR PUBLIC HEARING
Approve the application by Perkins & Will, on behalf of Paul Y. Construction (B.C.) LTD., Inc., to rezone the lands at 848 Seymour Street from DD District to CD-1 District, increase FSR to 17.67 and building height to 97.7 m for a 30-storey hotel.
Approve the draft CD-1 By-law prepared for the Public Hearing.
Approve the proposed form of development, with minor alterations allowed by the Director of Planning.
Approvals subject to Conditions of Approval in Appendix B.
Amend the Sign By-law to establish regulations for the new CD-1, subject to approval of the CD-1 By-law.
Instruct the Director of Legal Services to bring forward the amendment to the Sign By-law.
Amend the Noise Control By-law to include the CD-1, subject to approval of the CD-1 By-law.
Instruct the Director of Legal Services to bring forward the amendment to the Noise Control By-law.
Approve Recommendations A and C with the following conditions: (i) Passage of resolutions creates no legal rights or obligations, (ii) Approval does not obligate the City to enact a rezoning by-law, (iii) City officials have authority and discretion.
REPORT SUMMARY
Evaluate application to rezone 848 Seymour Street to CD-1 District for a hotel development. Staff support the application, subject to conditions. Recommend referral to public hearing with approval in principle, subject to conditions.

Background/Context

2. Policy Context
The Vancouver Plan, Cambie Corridor Plan, Cambie Corridor Public Realm Plan, Marpole Community Plan, Housing Needs Report, Housing Vancouver Strategy, and various other policies and by-laws are relevant to this application.
The City approved a Plan for the next 30 years, which will be implemented over the next two to four years. The site is located within the Cambie Corridor Plan area, which is aligned with the Vancouver Plan. The Cambie Corridor Plan allows for rezoning for a residential building up to six storeys with a floor space ratio (FSR) up to 2.5. An additional partial floor is permitted for common amenity space. 

On April 27, 2022, Council received a Housing Needs Report (HNR) prepared by staff. The Council must consider the most recent HNR when developing or amending a development plan related to affordable housing, rental housing, and special needs housing. The proposed zoning amendment would facilitate the delivery of secured rental housing, including below-market rental units, and address the data and findings within the HNR.

The rezoning proposal is for two six-storey residential buildings with 146 secured-market units.

The proposed floor space ratio is 2.0 and the maximum building height is 13.7 m (45 ft.), with additional height for the rooftop amenity and mechanical appurtenances. The General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability recommends approval of the rezoning application, subject to certain conditions. The draft CD-1 By-law and the proposed form of development are also recommended for approval. The approval is subject to the Conditions of Approval contained in the report. Additionally, the Subdivision By-law would be amended if the CD-1 By-law is approved. The passage of the resolutions does not create legal rights or obligations for the applicant or the City. The approval of the rezoning does not obligate the City to enact a by-law rezoning the property. The exercise of authority and discretion by the City and its officials is not limited or directed by the resolutions.

Report to Committee: Planning Committee
Date: November 6, 2023
From: Wayne Craig, Director, Development
File: RZ 22-011080
Re: Application by Gurjit Pooni for Rezoning at 10511 Lassam Road from the "Single Detached RS1/E" Zone to the "Single Detached (RS2/B)" Zone

Staff Recommendation: Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10513, for the rezoning of 10511 Lassam Road from the "Single Detached (RS1/E)" zone to the "Single Detached (RS2/B)" zone, be introduced and given first reading.

REPORT CONCURRENCE: Affordable Housing; CONCURRENCE OF GENERAL MANAGER

Staff Report:
Onyx Premier Homes Ltd. has applied to rezone 10511 Lassam Road from the "Single Detached (RS1/E)" zone to the "Single Detached (RS2/B)" zone. The purpose is to create two single-family lots with access from Lassam Road.

Findings of Fact:
- There is an existing vacant single-family dwelling on the subject property that will be demolished.
- There are no existing secondary suites in the dwelling.
- Surrounding development includes a school to the north, a single-family dwelling to the south, and single-family dwellings to the east.
- The proposed rezoning and subdivision are consistent with the Official Community Plan and Steveston Area Plan.
- The proposed lots comply with the Lot Size Policy.
- The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204.
- Public consultation has been conducted, but no comments have been received.

Analysis:
The proposed redevelopment will rezone and subdivide the existing single-family lot into two new single-family lots with access from Lassam Road. The rezoning and subdivision align with the lot fabric and vehicular access along Lassam Road.

Existing Legal Encumbrances:
There is an existing 3 m wide Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) for City sanitary service on a small portion of the property. No building encroachment into the SRW is permitted.

Transportation and Site Access:
Vehicular access to the proposed lots will be from Lassam Road.

Staff Report
Origin
Navreet Gill has applied on behalf of the property owners, 1303287 B.C. Ltd. (Balraj Singh Sanghera and Rajbir Kaur Chatha), to rezone 11831/11833 Seabrook Crescent from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone in order to permit the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from Seabrook Crescent. A location map and aerial photo are provided in Attachment 1. The proposed subdivision plan and draft site plan are provided in Attachment 2.
Findings of Fact
A Development Application Data Sheet providing details about the development proposal is attached (Attachment 3).
Subject Site Existing Housing Profile
The subject site contains an existing un-stratified non-conforming duplex (two-unit dwelling), which will be demolished prior to subdivision. Both dwelling units are currently tenant occupied and do not contain any secondary suites. The applicant has indicated that the tenants are aware of the redevelopment proposal and the applicant will ensure compliance with the Residential Tenancy Act.
Surrounding Development
Development immediately surrounding the site is as follows:
To the North: A single-family houses on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”.
To the South: A single-family houses on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”.
To the East: Across the lane, an existing duplex on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)” fronting onto No. 5 Road. There is a Rezoning application and Development Permit (RZ 22-019002/DP 23-028942) at 10111/10113 No. 5 Road to permit the development of three front-back duplex lots. The rezoning application received third reading on October 16, 2023.
To the West: Across Seabrook Crescent, an existing duplex on a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”.
Related Policies & Studies
Official Community Plan
The subject site is designated as “Neighbourhood Residential” in the Official Community Plan (OCP). This proposal is consistent with this OCP designation.
PH - 38
October 23, 2023
- 3 -
RZ 22-010976
7409688
Single-Family Lot Size Policy 5434/ Zoning Bylaw 8500
The subject property is located within the area covered by Lot Size Policy 5434, adopted by City Council in 1990, amended in 1991 and 2006 (Attachment 4). The Policy permits a majority of lots within the Policy Area (including the subject property) to be rezoned and subdivided in accordance with the provisions of the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone.
The subject site is currently occupied by a legal duplex. Section 2.3.7 of Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500 provides that the Lot Size Policy does not apply to a rezoning that a legal duplex and which are intended to be subdivided into no more than two single-family lots. The proposed rezoning and subdivision complies with Section 2.3.7 and would result in the creation of two single-family lots being 444.9 m2 and 450.2 m2 in area. Further, the proposed rezoning and subdivision would comply with the minimum lot dimensions and size applicable to the “Single Detached (RS2B)” zone.
Ministry of Transportation & Infrastructure Approval
As the subject site is located within 800 m of an intersection of a Provincial Limited Access Highway and a City road, this redevelopment proposal was referred to the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MOTI) for review and comment. Preliminary confirmation has been received from MOTI indicating that they have no objections to the proposed redevelopment. Final approval from MOTI is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.
Floodplain Management Implementation Strategy
The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. Registration of a flood indemnity covenant on Title is required prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.
Public Consultation
A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property. Staff have not received any comments from the public about the rezoning application in response to the placement of the rezoning sign on the property.
Should the Planning Committee endorse this application and Council grant first reading to the rezoning bylaw, the bylaw will be forwarded to a Public Hearing, where any area resident or interested party will have an opportunity to comment.
Public notification for the Public Hearing will be provided as per the Local Government Act and the City’s Zoning Bylaw 8500.

The purpose of this report is to provide Council with information on the proposal and recommend forwarding the rezoning application to a future Public Hearing.
Policy Section: The proposed rezoning application is consistent with various policies and plans adopted by Council.
Background: The subject site is part of the Buchanan West Master Plan and is designated for high-density mixed-use development. The site is currently improved with an older industrial warehouse building and surface parking. The initial rezoning report was received on June 20, 2022.

Development District will use RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, C3 General Commercial District, and Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan as guidelines. Applicant submitted a development plan for two high-rise residential apartment buildings on top of a commercial/retail podium and underground parking. Pedestrian access is available from Lougheed Highway and the future east-west street on the site's northern portion. The development will be constructed in a single phase. Both buildings sit on a 10-storey commercial podium that includes a hotel(s) with amenities and retail units. From: Wayne Craig, Director, Development
File: RZ 21-945869
Re: Application by Terra 8120 Number 1 Road Limited Partnership for Rezoning at 8120 and 8140 No. 1 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” Zone to the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)” Zone

Staff Recommendation: That Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10498, for the rezoning of 8120 and 8140 No. 1 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)” zone, be introduced and given first reading.

REPORT CONCURRENCE
Affordable Housing
CONCURRENCE OF GENERAL MANAGER
City of Richmond

Staff Report
Origin: Terra 8120 Number 1 Road Limited Partnership (on behalf of Cliff Chun and Kai Shen Hsiung of 1296168 BC Ltd. and Yi Jen Wang and Kai Shen Hsiung of Terra West Properties Ltd.) has applied to the City of Richmond for permission to rezone 8120 and 8140 No. 1 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)” zone, to permit the development of nine townhouse units, with vehicle access from No. 1 Road.

Findings of Fact
- The subject site consists of two lots located on the east side of No. 1 Road, between Blundell Road and Coldfall Road.
- The subject site consists of two lots, each containing a single-family dwelling that is tenant occupied. The existing dwellings are proposed to be demolished.
- Existing development surrounding the subject site includes three lots to the north, two with newer construction zoned “Compact Single Detached (RC1)” and one zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”, each containing a single-family dwelling.
- Existing development to the south is a lot zoned “Single Detached (RS1/E)”, containing a single-family dwelling, and a large lot zoned “Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)”, containing 28 townhouses.
- Existing development to the east consists of lots zoned “Single Detached (RS1/B)”, each containing a single-family dwelling fronting Corless Place.
- Existing development to the west across No. 1 Road are compact lots zoned “Single Detached (RS1/K)” and “Compact Single Detached (RC1)”, each containing a single-family dwelling.

Related Policies & Studies
- The Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for the subject properties is “Neighbourhood Residential”.
- The Arterial Road Land Use Policy designation for the subject properties is “Arterial Road Townhouse”.
- The development criteria for townhouses in the Arterial Road Land Use Policy call for land assembly with a minimum 50 m frontage on a major arterial road and avoiding the creation of residual sites with less than a 50 m frontage.
- The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204.

Public Consultation
- A rezoning sign has been installed on the subject property. Staff have not received any comments from the public about the rezoning application in response to the placement of the rezoning sign on the property.

Analysis
- The proposed development consists of nine townhouse units on a site that would be approximately 1,801.3 m2 (19,389 ft2) in area after the required 0.91 m wide road dedication along No. 1 Road.
- The proposed site layout consists of one three-storey building along the west side of the site facing No. 1 Road, two two-storey duplex buildings along the east side of the site along the interface with existing single-family housing fronting Corless Place, and an internal drive-aisle that runs north-south between the front and rear buildings.
- All units have an east-west orientation, with the main unit entries facing either No. 1 Road or the internal drive-aisle.
- Private outdoor space for the units fronting No. 1 Road is proposed primarily in the form of front yards at ground level with secondary decks on the upper levels facing either No. 1 Road or the internal drive-aisle. Private outdoor space for the two-storey units is proposed primarily in the form of rear yards.
- The location of the secondary upper decks will be refined during the Development Permit application review process.
- Common outdoor amenity space is proposed in the southeast corner of the site and meets the minimum guidelines in the OCP.
- The design of the common outdoor amenity space can be further examined during the DP application review process.
- The common outdoor amenity space can be expanded when the adjacent property to the south is redeveloped for townhouses.
- The applicant proposes to submit a contribution to the City's Leisure Facilities Reserve Fund instead of providing common indoor amenity space on-site.
- The contribution for the nine-unit townhouse proposal is $18,594.00.
- A City Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) is registered on Title for the sanitary sewer and encroachment is not permitted.
- The proposal is for nine strata-titled townhouse units.
- A restrictive covenant will be registered on Title to prohibit rental restrictions and age-based restrictions on occupants.
- Vehicle access to the site is proposed off No. 1 Road.
- Pedestrian access to the street-fronting units will be provided via individual pathways.
- On-site parking will be provided within each unit's garage.
- Two visitor surface parking spaces will be provided off the internal drive-aisle.
- Resident and visitor bike parking will be provided.
- A Certified Arborist's Report has been submitted, identifying trees on-site and off-site.
- Some trees on-site are in poor condition and should be removed and replaced.
- Trees on neighboring properties will be retained and protected.
- Tree protection measures will be implemented during the development stage.
- A tree survival security of $5,000.00 will be required for one tree.
- A total of 13 trees on-site are proposed to be removed.
- 26 replacement trees are required to be planted on-site.
- The applicant proposes to contribute $6,750.00 to the City's Tree Compensation Fund instead of planting the remaining nine replacement trees.
- The applicant is required to submit a Landscaping Security prior to DP issuance.
- Variance requests are being sought to reduce the minimum required lot width and allow six small vehicle parking spaces.
- Staff is supportive of the variance requests.
